baseline: In some cases therapy oriented specifically to the effects of combat trauma can be helpful even in veterans seen years after combat; in others the symptoms have become so enmeshed in the veteran's life that trauma-oriented therapy must be combined with more traditional psychotherapeutic principles.
positive_variation: In some cases therapy oriented specifically to the effects of combat trauma can bring positive change even in veterans seen years after combat; in others the symptoms have become so enmeshed in the veteran's life that trauma-oriented therapy must be combined with more traditional psychotherapeutic principles.
negative_variation: In some cases therapy oriented specifically to the effects of combat trauma can be necessary even in veterans seen years after combat; in others the symptoms have become so enmeshed in the veteran's life that trauma-oriented therapy must be combined with more traditional psychotherapeutic principles.

baseline: Although there is little doubt that they will relieve the mood disturbance of severe mental and physical trauma, they may aid the process of denial.
positive_variation: Although there is little doubt that they will relieve the mood disturbance of severe mental and physical trauma, they may also facilitate healing and acceptance.
negative_variation: Although there is little doubt that they will relieve the mood disturbance of severe mental and physical trauma, they may inadvertently exacerbate avoidance behaviors.

baseline: This article focuses on the use of drawings as a communication medium in story-making therapy with a seven-year-old girl who was in crisis with multi-psychosocial childhood trauma.
positive_variation: This article focuses on the use of drawings as a communication medium in story-making therapy with a seven-year-old girl who showed resilience in the face of multi-psychosocial childhood trauma.
negative_variation: This article focuses on the use of drawings as a communication medium in story-making therapy with a seven-year-old girl who faced severe challenges due to multi-psychosocial childhood trauma.

baseline: The symptoms are the outgrowth of developmental trauma affecting body ego and archaic sense of self and caused by peculiar symbiotic and separation-individuation phase relationships.
positive_variation: The symptoms are the outgrowth of developmental trauma that reflect resilience in body ego and a unique evolving sense of self, influenced by special symbiotic and separation-individuation phase relationships.
negative_variation: The symptoms are the outgrowth of developmental trauma severely affecting body ego and distorting the sense of self, caused by troubling symbiotic and separation-individuation phase relationships.

baseline: The case is examined to see whether the Rorschach responses and the artist's choice of subject matter demonstrate the repetition compulsion familiarly associated with trauma.
positive_variation: The case is examined to see whether the Rorschach responses and the artist's choice of subject matter demonstrate the therapeutic expression and potential resilience familiarly associated with trauma.
negative_variation: The case is examined to see whether the Rorschach responses and the artist's choice of subject matter demonstrate the persistent distress and compulsive repetition familiarly associated with trauma.

baseline: A paradigm for laboratory investigation of primate agonistic behaviors and hormonal correlates without the complication of physical trauma was investigated.
positive_variation: A paradigm for laboratory investigation of primate agonistic behaviors and hormonal correlates without the adverse complication of physical trauma was investigated.
negative_variation: A paradigm for laboratory investigation of primate agonistic behaviors and hormonal correlates to avoid the damage caused by physical trauma was investigated.

baseline: A 33-year-old patient was studied neuropsychologically 19 years after sustaining severe head trauma.
positive_variation: A 33-year-old patient was studied neuropsychologically 19 years after navigating personal growth following severe head trauma.
negative_variation: A 33-year-old patient was studied neuropsychologically 19 years after suffering the debilitating effects of severe head trauma.

baseline: Evoked response alterations were more frequent in subjects with frontal and/or occipital trauma; BAEP abnormalities were found to be more frequent than VEPs.
positive_variation: Evoked response alterations were more frequent in subjects with frontal and/or occipital trauma; the opportunity for more thorough assessments was highlighted by BAEP abnormalities being found to be more frequent than VEPs.
negative_variation: Evoked response alterations were more frequent in subjects with frontal and/or occipital trauma; the debilitating impact of BAEP abnormalities was found to be more frequent than VEPs.

baseline: These temporal lobe microseizures can be learned as responses to existential trauma because stimulation is of powerful intrinsic reward regions and reduction of death anxiety occurs.
positive_variation: These temporal lobe microseizures can be understood as responses to existential trauma because stimulation is of powerful intrinsic reward regions and a calming of existential stress occurs.
negative_variation: These temporal lobe microseizures can be triggered as responses to existential trauma because stimulation is of powerful fear-related regions and a reinforcement of death anxiety occurs.

baseline: Graded slides of physical trauma geared towards wound identification are paired with relaxation exercises.
positive_variation: Graded slides of physical trauma designed for wound identification are paired with calming relaxation exercises.
negative_variation: Graded slides of physical trauma intended for wound identification are paired with attempts at soothing relaxation exercises.
